Lack of mainstream news coverage: The expert noted that despite the prominence of the defendant and the significant damages sought in the lawsuit, there was no evidence of the incident being reported in mainstream news venues. This raised doubts about the authenticity of the claim.
Absence of court filing or evidence: The expert mentioned that they were unable to locate any court filing or other evidence to prove that the lawsuit was actually filed. This lack of concrete documentation cast doubt on the veracity of the claim.
Inaccurate photograph: The expert pointed out that the photograph used to illustrate the article was seemingly lifted from a 2014 BuzzFeed report about an unrelated case involving charges of murder and manslaughter. This discrepancy in the image used further undermined the credibility of the claim.
Source credibility: The expert highlighted that the sole source of the vacuum emasculation story was the World News Daily Report (WNDR), which they described as a notorious purveyor of junk news disguised as satire. The disclaimer on the WNDR website further reinforced that the content was fictional. This called into question the reliability of the source and the claim itself.
